intro: Elateriopsis oerstedii subsp. biolleyi, commonly known as the Bollé's elaterioide, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. It is native to parts of southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments.
